title: KSB (Kale Sausage Beans)
creator: Kristine Makiewicz
description: This recipe I found on a blog I've read for years “A Cup of Jo." They titled it “This Dinner is so good, It has a nickname!” When I first read the recipe I wasn't totally convinced, but we made it once and it became a staple. Once Kurt and I started loving KSB we became KSB evangelists! What I love now it that there are at least 3-4 friend / family groups that now have KSB as part of their go-to dinner recipes. We get messages all the time, ‘It’s a KSB night!” We love it with spicy Italian sausage, two bunches of kale and two cans of beans to really get the ratio right"
subject: recipe

title: Chicken and Stuffing with Italian Seasonings
creator: Joy Urban
description: Don’t omit the anchovy. It does not make the dish taste fishy but adds a magically savory flavor.
subject: recipe

title: Stuffed Cabbage Leaves (Gołąbki)
creator: Josh Clary
description: Our friends Jack and Kelly who lived in Romania for years introduced us to this dish and we make it often. It's really solid comfort food and is easily riffable
subject: recipe

title: Baked Tofu with Peanut Sauce and Coconut-Lime Rice
creator: Laura Urban
description: I'm always looking for new interesting ways to eat this low-on-the-food-chain and so-healthy protein. Tofu is like a blank slate that plays well with strong flavors, so spicy peanut butter makes for an easy sauce. With the raw greens and hot coconutty-rice, the mix of textures is really satisfying. This is one of my new favorite go-to options.
subject: recipe

title: Texas Hash
creator: Donald Urban; Esther Urban
description: This dish is one our favorites and has been for many years. Sprinkling with Parmesan is really good.
subject: recipe

title: Glazed Sweet Potato with Lentils
creator: Leslie Urban
description: As someone who has always pooh-poohed lentils, this is the recipe that made me a convert. I'll often bake the sweet potatoes as soon as I get home from the grocery, so on the evening I am eating it all it takes is the 20ish minutes it takes to cook the lentils to throw this all together.
subject: recipe

title: Farmer’s Market Frittata
creator: Katie Mikulka; Emy Urban
description: Emy and I have started making frittatas whenever we need a quick dinner or/and have a surplus of languishing produce. Both factors are usually in play on Friday nights, when both energy and fresh groceries are dangerously low. But its four portions are perfect for dinner on Friday and reheated leftovers make for a post Farmer’s Market brunch on Saturday. The veggie, dairy, and cheese combinations are endless here. But be aware of the moisture content, as that can prevent the frittata from setting. An overzealous attempt to use up a lot of tomatoes taught us that lesson the hard way... Leafy greens— like collards, spinach, and kale—shine here, as do onions, peppers, and mushrooms. Leftover meat or browned sausage would also be a delight! The options are endless. Serve with toast or potatoes.would also be a delight! The options are endless. Serve with toast or potatoes.would also be a delight! The options are endless. Serve with toast or potatoes.
subject: recipe

title: Kimchi Toast
creator: Kurt Makiewicz
description: This has become our Sunday breakfast since we get fresh bread delivered on Saturday.
subject: recipe

title: Chili Lime Seasoning
creator: Joy Urban
description: This is from Pepperscale.com. For an easy potluck dish I mix some up and toss with fresh pineapple chunks. Grind the spices yourself for the best flavor.
subject: recipe

title: Green Beans with Tomatoes, Onions, and Beans
creator: Leslie Urban
description: Simple but so tasty! The crusty French bread is key to making this feel like a filling meal on weekdays.
subject: recipe

title: Green Hummus
creator: Laura Urban
description: When you're tired of the regular hummus, which is flavored with lemon and soy sauce, and you have kale to use up from the bunch, try this one -- so good!
subject: recipe

title: Butternut Squash Soup
creator: Katie Mikulka; Emy Urban
description: This fall, Katie and I have gotten quite a few squashes in our CSA and we've found this soup is an easy and delicious way to use it up. The ginger and the rosemary/sage make for such a good flavor combination and we use our immersion blender to make it super creamy. We eat it with a side of crusty bread with butter. Makes for a pretty perfect fall lunch!
subject: recipe

title: Pa’s Chili
creator: Donald Urban
description: I like to use V8 juice because it adds some unique flavors. They may use tomato juice if they want.
subject: recipe

title: Josh's Thai Peanut Soup
creator: Josh Clary
description: Peanut Soup in Virginia is a regional tradition. I've had a lot of them, and many I didn't like. I came up with this Thai inspired version that is a great pantry ingredient soup.
subject: recipe

title: Minestrone Soup
creator: Kurt Makiewicz
description: Here's one of our favorite soups. It is written for a pressure cooker but can be done in a slow cooker or stovetop.
subject: recipe

title: Roasted Butternut Squash & Apple Soup with Bacon
creator: Josh Clary
description: The bacon and apple really add depth and brightness to this soup.
subject: recipe

title: Katie’s Caramelized Onion Dip
creator: Katie Mikulka
description: Onion dip is perhaps one of earth’s most perfect foods. This version, simplified and adapted from Alison Roman, is next level: sweet from the caramelized onions, a little spicy from the raw garlic, and incredibly creamy from the mix of dairy. Cooking the onions is time-consuming, but well worth it. Listen to a podcast while you stir, and your patience will be rewarded.
subject: recipe

title: Brown Butter Apple Loaf
creator: Josh Clary
description: I make this every year we go apple picking. It's a lot easier than making a pie and has a really nice texture from the nuts.
subject: recipe
